body:
I have narrowed it down to this line being called
```
\Cake\Routing\Router::url(['_name' => 'Tags::edit']);
```
this results in the controller name being changed from uppercase to lowercase.
Digging deeper...

Its the `$url = $this->_dasherize($url);` call inside the DashedRoute.
```
array (
  'controller' => 'Tags',
  'action' => 'edit',
  'plugin' => NULL,
)
```
will turn into
```
array (
  'controller' => 'tags',
  'action' => 'edit',
  'plugin' => NULL,
)
```

issue.title: 5.x: fix broken AuthUserHelperTests

repository.name: cakephp-tinyauth
repository.description: CakePHP TinyAuth plugin for an easy and fast user authentication and authorization. Single or multi role. DB or config file based.

issue.body:
Refs: https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/issues/17265

previously the DashedRoute was only used for fallback routes, not for all configured routes in the builder.

body: Don't know if its expected that URL array's like shown above will also be dasherized if used with the DashedRoute class.

> Don't know if its expected that URL array's like shown above will also be dasherized if used with the DashedRoute class.

Routing historically has not used dashed controller/action names. We should continue to do reverse routing with camelcase / camelbacked names.

Does that mean that the expected named route for dashed routing would be

    ['_name' => 'tags::edit'],
    
in this case? To match the `'controller' => 'tags'` part?

> Does that mean that the expected named route for dashed routing would be

Ideally I think the name used to generate the route should be consistent with the one used to define the route. Ideally each route class normalizes names in the same way. I think `DashedRoute` is the odd one out here though.

Last change for `DashedRoute` class was about 2 years ago, so I doubt there's a regression.

@dereuromark For you 2 failing tests you are actually missing `$builder->setRouteClass(DashedRoute::class);` statement after `$builder = Router::createRouteBuilder('/');`
@ADmad you mean exactly the 2 lines I removed in the linked PR above to fix the error?
@LordSimal Ah, I didn't notice your comment, still as I said `DashedRoute` has been unchanged for 2 years and the dasherizing of route defaults inside `match()` exists since it's creation.
That said I do have a solution to avoid inflecting the defaults while matching, will make a PR soon.

issue.title: Avoid inflecting URL parts when matching routes.

repository.name: cakephp
repository.description: CakePHP: The Rapid Development Framework for PHP - Official Repository

issue.body:
Inflect parts only when generating URL string.
Closes #17265

body: I was also pretty confused why this issue appeared here out of nowhere but in the end I do agree with your proposed solution.

We could add New Route classes that would fix this?
Or I could just have them in Shim plugin as opt in for those that want it.
In the end it isnt a big Deal if we dont fix itcin core directly.
I think there is a solution we can provide within CakePHP. I'll try to get a pull request together later this week.
